title: Official Blind Review #1
review_assessment:_checking_correctness_: I assessed the sensibility of the derivations and theory.
review:
The paper provides an unsupervised domain adaptation approach
in the context of deep learning. The motivation is clear, related work
sufficient and experimental settings and results convincing. 
I have only very minor comments:
- I would prefer to get the paper additionally linked to a few more
  transfer learning techniques out of the deep learning domain
  which is important as well
- do you really need to call it (multi) flow network .... - a flow network
  is a well established concept in algorithmics and refers to a graph problem
  ... to avoid name clashes ...
- in the references you have provided back links to the pages where the references
  are used - this is handy but also confusing and a bit unusual - I think it was not part 
  of the standard template
- please avoid using arxiv references but replace them by reviewed material. In parts
  I am willing to accept such kind of gray literature provided by well known authors but
  this should not become a standard habit
- I am happy to see that the code will be published - I hope this is really done, because
  from the material it maybe hard to reconstruct the method
